g.text: ideally partitions handle proportionally even load; no hotspots/skewed workloads
values are in sorted order, thus
avoid timestamp as part of key,
(hash does not need to be cryptographically strong,
can be used in queries, since
target partition pinned by first entry
it moves most keys if N changes
mapped to N nodes, as N grows, N+1 node "steals"
partitions from existing N node. Each node has
same number of partitions, and only a portion
of total num partitions is moved during rebalancing
Can also merge subranges in one range
Combination of dynamic + fixed. Each node has fixed number of partitions.
With new node, fixed number of existing partitions get split.
New node gets to own half of each split as its set of partitions.
(global, specific value index in one place)
writes are slower, i.e. insert of {color:red,make:BMW}
will update term-partitioned indexes on multiple partitions
routing info is shared for e.g. via gossip
if node does not have key,
